title: A Map of Places in the US with Shared Names
intro: There are thousands of cities and towns in the US that share their name with another place. We calculated what place someone is most likely referring to, depending on where they are.
discoverySummary: Not sure where to start? Check out some curated places.
details: County scores are based on an artisanal blend of proximity and recognition (population and Wikipedia article length). We know a lot of you will disagree with our method, so we made a sandbox that explains our choices, and lets you customize and share your own. Creating a data set of colloquially used places in the US is a mammoth task, so we are updating it as we learn more. You can help us improve the data with your local expertise.
help: Spot something wrong? Help us improve the data!
tableIntro: Every county gets a score on a 0-100 scale for each place based on a combination of proximity, population, and Wikipedia article length. Scores are split into three tiers; 75+ means it has a strong connection (probably), 50+ is less strong (maybe), and 50 is a weak connection (toss-up).
placeNote: A county counts towards a place if that place was the highest scoring in that county.
